info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 2:51PM MST until January 08 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SUNDAY TO 8 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Amounts approaching 6 inches across the peaks of the Sandia and Manzano Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, Espanola Valley, and Santa Fe Metro Area. * WHEN...From 5 PM Sunday to 8 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected from Sunday evening through Monday morning. Areas of blowing snow will be possible during this time period dropping visibilities below half a mile at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
